DOC.detailed_description: CONNECT-HF large-scale , pragmatic , cluster-randomized clinical trial evaluate effect 2 quality improvement ( QI ) initiative compare usual care heart failure ( HF ) outcomes HF quality care metric 1 year discharge participant hospitalize acute HF reduce ejection fraction ( EF ) . All participant trial consent longitudinal follow-up part CONNECT-HF registry clinical outcome , medication use , participant-centered outcome , include quality life ( QOL ) assessment , 6 week 3 , 6 , 12 month discharge . Two QI initiative evaluate trial : A health-system engagement strategy ( direct ) involve site visit ongoing mentor team healthcare professional specialize training field experience help health system individual hospital design local quality improvement plan . A participant engagement strategy ( digital ) mobile application utilizing behavioral tool reinforce health behavior , include self-monitoring/self-management medication adherence . After index hospitalization HF , longitudinal information management ( ie , HF medication ) , QOL assessment , resource utilization collect . Follow-up occur via centralized telephone interview train personnel via DCRI Call Center . At interview , participant ask report current medication , rehospitalizations , QOL assessment . Based participant-reported event , medical billing data rehospitalizations , emergency department visit , procedure obtain . Quality life assessment include Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire ( KCCQ ) EuroQOL five dimension questionnaire ( EQ-5D ) .
